title: Will Not Remain Running and Quits Right After Start
author: itgl72
body_snippet: When I click to start mRemoteNG on Windows 10 I can see its process pop up for a moment but then disappear a second later. It does this with MSI and Portable versions. I have uninstalled and re-installed several times. I have attempted to find left over items in the registry and the file system. Since it never starts there is no user.config file to remove, it doesn't exist. I have searched all of the event logs for mention of '*mremoteng*' and found nothing reflecting an error or warning. There ...

iterations.description: Application crashes immediately on startup, indicating a critical unhandled exception during initialization that prevents normal operation.

comments.author: farosch
comments.snippet:
Check for any .NET errors in your event viewer.
If so try this: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/2698555/microsoft-net-framework-repair-tool-is-available

comments.author: itgl72
comments.snippet: The only way I Was able to work around this was to install to a non "program files" folder. In my case I installed it to C:\Tools and the application then allowed me to start and use it again.

comments.author: PetbkA
comments.snippet:
> The only way I Was able to work around this was to install to a non "program files" folder

May be [UAC](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/windows/it-pro/windows-server-2008-R2-and-2008/dd835548(v=ws.10)) has something to do with this? It has some protection mechanisms for _Program Files_ and _Program Files (x86)_ folders.

Have you tried to disable UAC? It can be disabled via Control Panel + by setting _EnableLUA_ parameter (DWORD type) to 0  in _HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWA...

notes:
AI triage (gemini): Application crashes immediately on startup, indicating a critical unhandled exception during initialization that prevents normal operation.
Approach: Debug the application's startup sequence, focusing on the ProgramRoot.cs Main method and the FrmMain loading process, to identify the source of the unhandled exception. This will likely involve stepping through the code, inspecting configuration loading, and checking dependency initializations.
